ai-patthana16.85:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.85:0.3_0: Telling on the rapture and joy that enjoys the happiness of the dead,
ai-patthana16.85:1.1_0: Not seeing the cause of excessiveness and happiness that arise from the household life, or with the rapture and bliss that arises.
ai-patthana16.85:1.1_1: Not seeing the talk about the dealing with happiness, joy arises in him. ...
ai-patthana16.85:1.1_2: Such things don’t arise when you’re not surprised with rapture. You don’t give rise to the rapture of bliss.
ai-patthana16.85:2.1_0: One who doesn’t have the rebirth of non-existence does not give rise to the repulsion. This is how he has no cause or condition for the sake of grasping.
ai-patthana16.85:2.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
